gurmukhi: ik swvMq s`jy ]ik nIswx b`jy ]ik jMjÍwl kRoDM ]ik ibswir boDM ]46]273]
transliteration: Ki Saavant Sajje|| Ki Neesaan Bajje|| Ki Janjvaal Krodhan|| Ki Bidaar(i) Bodhan||46||273||
translation: The warriors were decorated and the trumpets were sounded; the fighters were enraged like fire and they were not even slightly in senses.46.273.

gurmukhi: ik AwhwV mwnI ]ik jXoN m`C pwnI ]ik SsqRwsqR bwhy ]ik jXoN jIq cwhY ]47]274]
transliteration: Ki Aahaad Maanee|| Ki Jyon Machchh Paanee|| Ki Shastraastra Baahai|| Ki Jyon Jeet Chaahai||47||274||
translation: The warriors were pleased in the war like the fish in water; they were striking blows with their arms and weapons, desirous of getting victorious.47.274.

gurmukhi: ik swvMq sohy ]ik swrMg rohy ]ik SsqRwsqR bwhy ]Bly sYx gwhy ]48]275]
transliteration: Ki Saavant Sohe|| Ki Saaran Rohe|| Ki Shastraastra Baahe|| Bhale Sain Gadhe||48||275||
translation: The bows are infuriated; the warriors are looking splendid and they are destroying the army.48.275.

gurmukhi: ik BYrau BB`kY ]ik kwlI kuh`kY ]ik jogMn ju`tI ]ik lY pqR Gu`tI ]49]276]
transliteration: Ki Bhairau Bhabhakkai|| Ki Kaalikuhakkai|| Ki Jogadn Jouttee|| Ki Lai Patra Ghouttee||49||276||
translation: The goddess Kali is laughing, the Bhairavas are thundering and holding their vassels in the hands, the Yoginis have gathered together for drinking blood.49.276.

gurmukhi: ik dyvI dm`kY ]ik kwlI kuh`kY ]ik BYro BkwrY ]ik faurU fkwrY ]50]277]
transliteration: Ki Devidamakkai|| Ki Kaalikuhakkai|| Ki Bhairo Bhakdarai|| Ki Dauroo Dakdarai||50||277||
translation: The goddess is resplendent and the goddess Kali is shouting, the Bhairvas are thundering and are sounding their tabors.50.277.

gurmukhi: ik bhu SsqR brKy ]ik prmwsqR krKy ]ik deIqwsqR Cu`ty ]ik dyvwsqR mu`ky ]51]278]
transliteration: Ki Bahu Shastra Barkhe|| Ki Parmaastra Karkhe|| Ki Daeetaastra Chhoutte|| Ki Devaastra Moukke||51||278||
translation: There is shower of weapons and the dreadful arms are crackling; the arms of the demons are being discharged from one side and the arms of gods are being used form the other side.51.278.

gurmukhi: ik sYlwsqR swjy ]ik paunwsqR bwjy ]ik myGwsqR brKy ]ik AgnwsqR krKy ]52]2798]
transliteration: Ki Sailaastra Saaje|| Ki Paounaastra Baaje|| Ki Meghaastra Barkhe|| Ki Agnaastra Kakhe||52||279||
translation: The Shailastras, Pavanastras and Meghastras are being showered and the fire-arms are crackling.52.279.

gurmukhi: ik hMswsqR Cu`ty ]ik kwksqR qu`ty ]ik myGwsqR brKy ]ik sUkRwsqR krKy ]53]280]
transliteration: Ki Hansaastra Choutte|| Ki Kaakastra Toutte|| Ki Meghaastra Barkhe|| Ki Sookraastra Karkhe||53||280||
translation: The Hansastras, Kakastras and Meghastras are being showered and the Shukarastras are crackling.53.280.

gurmukhi: ik swvMqR s`jy ]ik bXomwsqR g`jy ]ik j`CwsqR Cu`ty ]ik ikMnRwsqR mu`ky ]54]281]
transliteration: Ki Saavantra Sajje|| Ki Byomaastra Gadje|| Ki Jachhhaastra Choutte|| Ki Kinnaastra Moukke||54||281||
translation: The warriors are bedecked, the Vyomastras are thundering the Yakshastras are being discharged and the Kinnarastras are getting exhausted.54.281.

gurmukhi: ik gMDRbwsqR bwhY ]ik nr AsqR gwhY ]ik cMcwl nYxM ]ik mY m`qR bYxM ]55]282]
transliteration: Ki Gaddhrabaastra Baahai|| Ki Nar Astra Gadhai|| Ki Channdhaal Nainan|| Ki Mai Mattra Bainan||55||282||
translation: The Gandharvastras are being discharged and the Narastras are also being used; the eyes of all the warriors are restless and all are uttering,”I”.55.282.

gurmukhi: ik AwhwV if`gY ]ik Awrkq iB`gY ]ik SsqRwsqR b`jy ]ik swvMq g`jy ]56]283]
transliteration: Ki Aahaad Diggad|| Ki Aarakt Bhiggad|| Ki Shastraasta Bajje|| Ki Saavant Gadje||56||283||
translation: The warriors saturated with blood have fallen in the war-arena and with the sounds of arms weapons, the warriors are also thundering.56.283.

gurmukhi: ik Awvrq hUrM ]ik swvrq pUrM ]iPrI AYx gYxM ]ik Awrkq nYxM ]57]284]
transliteration: Ki Aavart Hooran|| Ki Saavart Pooran|| Phiriain Gadnan|| Ki Aarkat Nainan||57||284||
translation: The groups of the red-eyed heavenly damsels are roaming in the sky for the warriors.57.284.

gurmukhi: ik pwvMg pu`ly ]ik srbwsqR Ku`ly ]ik hMkwr bwhY ]ADM A`iD lwhY ]58]285]
transliteration: Ki Paavan Pulle|| Ki Sarbaastra Khulle|| Ki Hankaar Baahai|| Adhan Addh(i) Laahai||58||285||
translation: The horses in flocks are roaming hither and thither and the warriors in their anger, are segmenting them.58.285.

gurmukhi: CutI eIs qwrI ]ik sMnXws DwrI ]ik gMDrb g`jy ]ik bwidqR b`jy ]59]286]
transliteration: Chhoutiees Tdaree|| Ki Sannyaas Dhdaree|| Ki Gaddhrab Gadje|| Ki Baaditra Bajje||59||286||
translation: The meditation of the great Sannyasi Shiva has been broken and even he is listening to the thundering of Gandharvas and the playing of the musical instruments.59.286.
